wordpressWpDailyReads.title: Daily Reads 4/16/2019
wordpressWpDailyReads.content:
Real Estate

D.C.’s Professional Tennis Team To Open New Stadium On Top Of Union Market

The Washington Kastles will play the 2019 season and future seasons in a new venue Edens will construct on top of the food hall buidling at 1309 5th St. NE.

 

Economy

Wage growth is accelerating, and that may be bad news for stock-market bulls

Average hourly earnings grew at an annual rate of 3.2% in March, down from 3.4% in February, but well above the 2.3% average annual pace seen over the past 10 years, according to the Labor Department.

 

Here’s one sign in bonds that the U.S. is poised for a sharp economic slowdown in 2019

Stock-market bulls are mistaken if they expect the Federal Reserve’s recent monetary-policy pivot, and the subsequent retreat in inflation-adjusted debt yields, or real yields, will juice growth later in 2019 following a poor first-quarter, says Capital Economics’s Michael Pearce.

 

Business

Why No One Wants to Invest in Currency Hedge Funds Anymore

Currency-only hedge funds were once a hot corner of the investment world. From 2000 to 2008 the tally of currency funds tracked by the BarclayHedge Currency Traders Index almost tripled, to 145. Now they’re looking more like an endangered species, with just 49 in operation.

 

This Software Can Uncover the Questions CEOs Don’t Want to Answer

For as long as companies have hosted quarterly conference calls, analysts and journalists have tried to parse not just what a company’s executives say, but how they say it.
